docs.summary: The Lottie element is used for embedding and customizing a Lottie animation.
description: The [Lottie](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-and-setting-up-ellipsis-text) element allows you to embed and customize your [Lottie](https://airbnb.design/lottie/) animation. You can [`play`](), [`pause`](), and [`stop`]() your animation. You can set the [`speed`]() of your animation and whether it plays in a [`loop`]().
![Lottie](images/lottie.png "Lottie")
### Set Up Your Lottie Element

After adding the Lottie component to your site, change the [`src`]() of the Lottie element to an external Lottie animation URL, for example, `'https://assets6.lottiefiles.com/private_files/lf30_vuxs5lpt.json'`, or to a valid Lottie JSON file imported to your page code.
Your Lottie JSON file should look something like this [animation.json](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-web/blob/master/docs/json/animation.json) file.
While your Lottie JSON file doesn't need all the key-value properties listed in this file, it must include the following properties and types for your Lottie JSON file to be valid.
| Properties           | Type             |
| "w", "h", "ip", "op" | Number           |
| "assets", "layers"   | Array of Objects |

To import the valid Lottie JSON file to your page code, create a new public js file for your valid Lottie JSON code. Then export the function from your public file and import it in your page code. Learn more about [exporting and importing functions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-where-do-i-put-my-code#i-want-some-code-to-run-on-multiple-but-not-all-pages).

docs.summary: Sets or gets a Lottie animation's alt text.
description: A Lottie animation's alternative text is typically a relatively short phrase that
describes what the animation depicts.
The alternative text is used:
+ If the browser cannot display the animation.
+ If the user is utilizing a screen reader.
+ By search engines to understand what animations are on your site.

examples.title: Get the Lottie animation's alt text
Set the Lottie animation's alt text

docs.summary: Whether the Lottie animation plays in a loop.

examples.title: Play the lottie animation in a loop

docs.summary: Sets or gets the total play time of the current Lottie animation, in seconds.

examples.title: Get the current Lottie animation's speed
Set the current Lottie animation's speed

docs.summary: Sets or gets the source of the Lottie animation.
description: Setting the `src` property changes the displayed LottieEmed element to
the Lottie animation found at the new `src` value.
Getting the `src` property returns the source of the
current Lottie animation.
The Lottie animation can either be an external Lottie animation URL, for example, `'https://assets6.lottiefiles.com/private_files/lf30_vuxs5lpt.json'`, or
a valid Lottie JSON file imported to your page code.
### A Valid Lottie JSON File

Your Lottie JSON file should look something [like this](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-web/blob/master/docs/json/animation.json). For the Lottie JSON file to be valid, the file must include the following properties and types:
| Properties           | Type |
| "w", "h", "ip", "op" | Number           |
| "assets", "layers"   | Array of Objects |

To import the valid Lottie JSON file to your page code, create a new public js file for your valid Lottie JSON code. Then export the function from your public file and import it in your page code. Learn more about [exporting and importing functions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-where-do-i-put-my-code#i-want-some-code-to-run-on-multiple-but-not-all-pages).

examples.title: Get the Lottie animation's source URL
Get the Lottie animation's source file
Set the Lottie animation's source to be an external URL
Set the Lottie animation's source to be an imported valid JSON file

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the playback has been paused.

description: The `pause()` function pauses the current Lottie animation.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the playback begins or resumes.

description: The `play()` function plays the current Lottie animation.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the playback has been stopped.

description: The `stop()` function stops the current playback,
moves to the beginning of the animation.
